<scp file="user:password@somehost:/home/chuck/**" todir="/home/sara"/>

text:
Unless I'm misunderstanding what you describe it seems to work for me (may be a different version of JSch):

stefan@v30161:~/ant> pwd
/home/stefan/ant
stefan@v30161:~/ant> ls -l
total 4
drwxr-xr-x  2 stefan users 4096 2009-08-21 13:09 bar
stefan@v30161:~/ant> ls -l bar/
total 0
-rw-r--r--  1 stefan users 0 2009-08-21 13:09 baz

You see, /home/stefan/ant only contains a single directory.

Build file on a different machine

<project>
  <scp file="stefan:***@v30161:/home/stefan/ant/**" todir="."/>
</project>

Result:

$ ./build.sh -f ../../Temp/s.xml
Buildfile: c:\Temp\s.xml
